Chapters

HTMLTemplateNode

A node that is a placeholder in a Form template.  This tag will replace itself with other HTML nodes when HTMLNode::templateClone is used.  Otherwise, it behaves as a HTMLText node.

Summary
HTMLTemplateNode
A node that is a placeholder in a Form template.
Functions
__construct
templateClone
Replaces this node with other nodes.
ErrorPlaceholder
A node that represents a position where an error message may be placed.

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($id)

Parameters

$idThe name of this node, this is used in the replacement to determine what nodes come in place of this node.

templateClone

public function templateClone($params)

Replaces this node with other nodes.  The parameter array should contain an entry for this node’s id.  These nodes are then returned instead of this node.

ErrorPlaceholder

A node that represents a position where an error message may be placed.  The node itself does nothing special.
Generated by Natural Docs
public function __construct($id)
public function templateClone($params)
Replaces this node with other nodes.
public function templateClone($params)
Clones this node and its children, replacing template placeholders.
Holds plain text.
